alert.note: Alert for Bienville; Jackson; Lincoln; Natchitoches; Ouachita; Winn (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 02 at 5:01PM CST until January 02 at 8:15PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Jackson Parish in north central Louisiana... Southern Lincoln Parish in north central Louisiana... Southwestern Ouachita Parish in north central Louisiana... Northwestern Winn Parish in north central Louisiana... Southeastern Bienville Parish in northwestern Louisiana... North Central Natchitoches Parish in northwestern Louisiana... * Until 815 PM CST. * At 501 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ruston, Grambling, Jonesboro, Choudrant, Simsboro, Hodge, Goldonna, North Hodge, Vienna, Dodson, East Hodge, Saline, Quitman, Eros, Mount Olive, Liberty Hill and Friendship. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Bienville; Jackson; Lincoln; Natchitoches; Ouachita; Winn
